articles.author: Ankika Biswas, Shristi A
articles.description: Nasdaq led declines in key Wall Street indexes on Thursday as a jump in Treasury yields knocked down growth stocks after the Federal Reserve signaled that another rate hike was in the offing this year.
articles.title: Nasdaq slides over 1% as growth stocks fall after hawkish Fed drives up yields

articles.author: Karen Brettell
articles.description: Benchmark 10-year U.S. Treasury yields rose to 16-year highs on Thursday, a day after the Federal Reserve surprised investors by flagging the potential for an additional rate hike, and an expectation for fewer cuts next year.
articles.title: 10-year yields hit 16-year peak as Fed seen higher for longer

articles.author: Hyunjoo Jin
articles.description: The United Auto Workers (UAW) and the Detroit Three automakers were still at loggerheads with Friday's deadline looming for a threatened expansion of the union's U.S. strikes.
articles.title: Detroit Three under pressure to progress UAW talks, avoid wider auto strikes

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Cisco Systems (CSCO.O) on Thursday agreed to acquire cybersecurity company Splunk (SPLK.O) for about $28 billion, in its biggest acquisition ever that would bolster its network security business.
articles.title: Cisco beefs up cybersecurity play with $28 bln Splunk deal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits unexpectedly fell last week, but could rebound in the weeks ahead as a partial strike by the United Auto Workers (UAW) union forces automobile manufacturers to temporarily lay off workers because of shortages of some materials.
articles.title: US weekly jobless claims unexpectedly fall

articles.author: Lewis Krauskopf
articles.description: Some of the shine is wearing off shares of Nvidia (NVDA.O) and other U.S. semiconductor companies after a stunning 2023 rally, as investors weigh steep valuations, rising Treasury yields and signs of industry unease.
articles.title: Nvidia, other US chip stocks stall over valuation, industry worries

articles.author: Tom Hals
articles.description: A legal team that forced Tesla's (TSLA.O) directors to agree in July to return more than $700 million in compensation to the automaker for allegedly overpaying themselves are now seeking a huge payday of their own.
articles.title: Lawyers who sued Tesla board for excess pay want $10,000 an hour

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle, Makini Brice
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy arrived at the U.S. Capitol on Thursday as Republican skeptics question whether Congress should approve a new round of aid for his country despite slow progress fighting Russian invaders.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy arrives at US Capitol to address skeptical Republicans

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Media mogul Rupert Murdoch has stepped down as the chairman of Fox Corp (FOXA.O) and News Corp (NWSA.O), the companies said on Thursday.
articles.title: Rupert Murdoch steps down as chairman of Fox, News Corp

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A bus crashed on a highway in New York state on Thursday in what authorities described as a "mass casualty" incident, and CNN reported at least one person was killed. CNN and local media outlets said the bus was carrying members of a high school band.
articles.title: Bus crashes on highway in New York state; officials report 'mass casualty' event
